throughout history word-of-mouth
storytelling has served as somewhat of a
catalyst to confusion with various
mysteries and urban legends oftentimes
true and factual events can be lost in

into something that only somewhat

that could have taken place no matter
what it may be such is the case with one
urban legend surrounding a very infamous
piece of video game hardware over in
Calumet City Illinois in a once revered
arcade by the name of friar Tuck's game
room a machine that housed the classic
arcade game berserk has been widely
regarded as completely cursed
selectively killing off players that
would come into contact with a game's
primary antagonist being a character by
the name of evil Otto but was this truly
the case did this legendary arcade
console doomed the lives of those that
played it or was this somewhat of an
urban legend that was twisted through
time tonight we embark to find out
welcome to the pilot episode of console
conspiracies this is a new series and
I'm launching now a primarily focus on
video game urban legends and mysteries
that have surfaced throughout history
with this series we'll be covering not
only mysteries from the distant past but
also more recent ones from newer video
games as well with that out of the way
it's time to head back in time to the
early 1980s to dive into the mystery of
the killer arcade game and the curse of
evil Otto
to kick this off we need to direct our
attention over to the town of Calumet
City Illinois contrary to its name it's
actually a small suburban town south of
Chicago that holds a present-day
population of about 30,000 people being
located in Illinois the region is no
stranger to large snowstorms and bitter
winters keep this in mind when heading
directly south from a city of Chicago
you'll know that you reach Calumet City
due to their renowned smiley-faced
towers that the town is mostly known for
these water towers that are painted
bright yellow and adorned with two
simple smiley faces actually form a
point of irony for where we're heading
in this mystery more on that later a
long-running arcade by the name of friar
Tuck's game room is where the heart of
our urban legend lies conveniently
located just south of the Holy Cross
Cemetery in southwest Calumet City here
a man by the name of Tom blankly what's
its owner and was so for 22 years to
establish a sort of timeline for when
these urban legends began to spread we
have to keep in mind that all of this
that were about to get into took place
around 1982 so it's safe to say that the
lifespan of friar Tuck's was in its very
early infancy as it had just opened two
years prior this newly budding arcade
was adorned in medieval theming with
tons of arcade games that also were
utilized in the game rooms many
championship tournaments throughout the
years there was one game out of the
bunch though that was met with endless
legends and disturbing mysteries
conspiring around it being the berserk
arcade game itself before we get into
those though let's take a look at the
video game itself what is it
berserk is a 4-way shooter that was
released the same year that fire tux
opened in 1980 players take control of a
greenstick figure representing what the
game calls a humanoid and the gameplay
focuses on sending your humanoid through
various mazes filled with killer robots
that fire lasers at you essentially your
goal is to take them out players can be
killed by either being shot running into
robots
coming in
contact with various electrified walls
or being touched by the games primary
nemesis himself a bright yellow smiley
face by the name of evil otto ironic
being contrary to a typical villain from
the era there actually wasn't any way to
kill evil otto at all he'd run it half
the players speed once they were killing
robots but as they take them out he'd
become progressively faster and faster
understandably this was the source for
quite a bit of stress for novice and
unsuspecting players so what was the
deal with this guy why was he considered
so cursed well as it turns out evil otto
has had a profound impact on the lives
of three players in particular all of
whom played the same machine at this
very arcade three guys by the name of
Peter pukowski Jeff Daly and Edward
Clark jr. had all met their demise
shortly after playing and all in a short
span of about a year or two legend has
it that evil otto was able to kill both
Bukowski and Daly in real life and had a
direct influence in the stabbing death
of Clark jr. but was this really the
case let's head back and take a dive
into their stories to find some answers
on the cold Saturday morning of April
3rd 1982 Peter Bukowski an eighteen year
old of South Holland Illinois awoke to
overcast and immensely cold temperatures
having endured one of the harshest
winters on record at the time
snow was without a doubt blanketing the
entire town and as we could assume
Bukowski was most likely trying to
figure out the best way to spend his
Saturday
according to a record of events he spent
his day as ordinary as you might expect
he started off by playing video games
alone in his room then headed over to
his girlfriend's house that afternoon
then off to a friend's before closing
out the day with a visit to the renowned
friar Tuck's game room that evening you
see
Bukowski seemed like an entirely healthy
teenager and there weren't exactly any
warning signs about him physically
he weighed 172 pounds with no
pre-existing medical conditions so it's
safe to say that he was pretty healthy
or so we thought more on that shortly
like I said this was one of the harshest
winters on record and Bukowski's
transportation of choice wasn't by car
nor bike but instead by walking the
entirety of his route from his house to
his girlfriend's than back home than to
his friends then to the game room came
out to total at about four miles and if
you're unaware walking long distances
through snow is pretty physically taxing
on the body anyway
Bukowski eventually heads over to friar
Tuck's with Ben Everett the friend that
he was visiting and along the way
complains about being on a breath and
thirsty the two then proceeded to stop
at a store along the way to pick up a
soda and after quickly downing it they
were probably back on the road to their
destination once they arrived it was
clearly evident that Bukowski wasn't
well however he simply brushed it off as
him being tired from his long walks out
in the snow all day afterwards he
proceeded to jump on berserk and played
a couple of games in the span of about
25 or so minutes both with high scores
once he went forth to play his third
game he placed he get another high score
entered his initials and some high score
records at the end backed away from the
machine itself and dropped after this
attendance from the arcade rushed to his
aid and attempted to administer CPR
while
ambulances on their way once they picked
him up and took him to the hospital
he was announced dead on arrival as you
might have guessed from this point
forward urban legends and theories began
to circulate about his bizarre passing
many speculated that it was the work of
the game central protagonist primarily
due to the fact that it took the form of
a disturbingly simple yellow smiley face
but what really was it was it evil Otto
that placed a curse on him and caused
him to drop dead or was it something
else according to medical experts Peter
had a rare heart disease called a
rhythmic genic right ventricular
cardiomyopathy essentially this is a
form of apparent disease pediatric
cardiology which causes the heart to
replace healthy tissue with fat and scar
tissue and if the body has worked hard
enough can cause sudden death and
victims in Bukowski's case his condition
was at a point to where it presented him
with a critical threats through his four
mile trek and the harsh winter snow
which is already physically taxing on
healthy individuals the combination of
his unfortunate circumstances resulted
in his demise so Peter didn't die from a
berserk curse and evil Otto didn't
exactly reach out of the screen to kill
him in real life it was all attributed
to a very unfortunate underlying heart
condition so berserk isn't cursed right
well you see like I stated prior his
bizarre death wasn't an isolated
incident as a second man by the name of
Jeff Daly allegedly passed away there
three months prior after playing berserk
as well

as word of Bukowski's death began to
spread by word of mouth in the months
that followed a now-defunct video game
called video ace decided to capitalize
on the fear surrounding the supposedly
killer video game and published a fake
articles that outlines the death of Jeff
Daly this 19 year old from Virginia
allegedly suffered a massive heart
attack On January 12th 1981 after
Manning the helm of this video game for
hours on end legend has it that when he
passed he had accumulated a very
strangely ominous high score containing
the number of the devil being sixteen
thousand six hundred and sixty
interestingly though Daly didn't exactly
end up dying this way at all he was
actually living in Virginia at the time
many many miles away from fire Tech's

near a berserk machine he didn't even
dial in January 12th of that year it
actually happened by car crash on May
29th nearly an entire year before the
pukowski incident even happened
furthermore according to berserk
champion Grant Diamond a score of
sixteen thousand six hundred and sixty
is extremely low even 480 standards to
rack up he explained quote there's no
possible way to play hours on a game of
berserk on one quarter and only get 16 K
if evil Otto wasn't a part of the game
then I'd agree none of the claims by

they fittingly closed up shop a few
months after this publication went out
there was one death however that was
tied to berserk that being one situation
that our victim by the name of Edward
Clark jr. found himself tangled in late
one night on March 20th 1988 nearly six
years after the passing of Bukowski
across the street from friar Tuck's game
room is a mall by the name of River Oaks
Clark was known to hang out there from
time to time with his friends and on the
night of March 20th
he left the location to head down to the
arcade that was conveniently only a
couple blocks away upon arriving he
played a few rounds of some other arcade
games before jumping on the same exact
machine the Bukowski had met his demise
with years prior interestingly here
though there were a few quarters that
were sitting out on the machine
unclaimed like most would do Clark
innocently took one and put it into the
machine to begin playing however once he
did that a troublemaker by the name of
Pedro Roberts stepped out from behind
some other arcade machines and began
claiming that those were actually his
which we later learned was a lie after a
brief altercation between the two Clark
ended up holding his ground and Roberts
claimed that he needed to get off the
machine quote or else before he
attempted to pick a fight with one of
Clark's friends allegedly he then pulled
a knife and threatened the group of
friends with aids before he was promptly
kicked out of the arcade and sent home
by staff
fearing for Clark's safety they forbade
him for leaving for ten minutes as to
allow Roberts to get to a far enough
distance away to make it home safely and
uninterrupted after stressing not to
walk the same direction as Roberts to
head back home
Clark ended up ignoring this advice and
went the same way anyway after a short
walk of just one block through the night
he encountered Pedro Roberts and his
group of friends waiting in an alleyway
located here and before he could make a
move was stabbed directly in the chest
with his friends in shock and Roberts
fleeing they wanted to rush him to the
hospital however Clark immediately
declined for some reason saying that he
was okay this however would end up
leading to his own death as he was in
actuality not okay
and moments later collapsed before being
sped to a nearby hospital where he'd
also be pronounced dead on arrival
two years later in May of 1990 pedro
roberts was eventually tried and
convicted for the murder of Edward Clark
jr. however since he pled in
self-defense
he was only sentenced to 11 years with
the potential for parole after only
three so with these three cases that all
happened at the same game room on the
infamous berserk the game is surely
cursed right well it seems that that's
what people want to think throughout
recent history humanity has always
fought to find some sort of supernatural
connection to video games
this all took place back during a time
when gaming was in its very early
infancy and was far and large a very new
concept to the world
The Legend of polybius was taking place
concurrently to all of this and society
was truly led to believe that there was
some sort of entity that was possessing

think about it we always try to find

fear of the unknown is a very real thing
and I guess a modern parallel to this

home Siri and whichever other voice

things like this but I digress the
deaths of Peter Bukowski Jeff Daly and
Edward Clark jr. will forever go down in

said we try to draw connections to

were completely and totally coincidental
Evil Otto is not to get you the physical
game machine doesn't suck the life out

a video game that was truly beloved and
feared during a time when these things
weren't exactly completely understood
